Package org.opensextant.geodesy

Class PolarStereographic

java.lang.Object
org.opensextant.geodesy.PolarStereographic
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class PolarStereographic extends Object implements Serializable
The PolarStereographic class implements a map projection of the same name, and is used by the Universal Polar Stereographic (UPS) coordinate encoding system for points near the North or South Poles. TODO: implement equals() and hashCode() methods.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    PolarStereographic(Latitude latOfTrueScale)
    This constructor makes an instance of PolarStereographic (initialized with WGS84 ellipsoid, origin at North Pole Prime Meridian).

    This method is used to set the Ellipsoid model parameters.
    @NotNull Geodetic2DPoint
    toGeodetic(double easting, double northing)
    This method converts Polar Stereographic projection (easting and northing) coordinates to geodetic (latitude and longitude) coordinates, according to the current ellipsoid and Polar Stereographic projection parameters.

    This method converts geodetic (latitude and longitude) coordinates to Polar Stereographic projection (easting and northing) coordinates, according to the current ellipsoid and Polar Stereographic projection coordinates.

  • Constructor Details

    • PolarStereographic

      public PolarStereographic(Latitude latOfTrueScale)
      This constructor makes an instance of PolarStereographic (initialized with WGS84 ellipsoid, origin at North Pole Prime Meridian). Ellipsoid can be changed with call to setEllipsoid.
      Parameters:
      latOfTrueScale - Latitude of True Scale (sign determines hemisphere of projection)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if latOfTrueScale is null

  • Method Details

    • setEllipsoid

      public void setEllipsoid(Ellipsoid ellip)
      This method is used to set the Ellipsoid model parameters. This is only needed if the default WGS84 ellipsoid is not being used, since WGS84 values are the default.
      Parameters:
      ellip - Ellipsoid object to use
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if ellip is null

    • getEllipsoid

      @NotNull public @NotNull Ellipsoid getEllipsoid()
      This method will return the currently set Ellipsoid for this PolarStereographic instance.
      Returns:
      ellipsoid model of the earth currently being used by this PolarStereographic object

    • toPolarStereographic

      @NotNull public @NotNull Topocentric2DPoint toPolarStereographic(Longitude lon, Latitude lat) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This method converts geodetic (latitude and longitude) coordinates to Polar Stereographic projection (easting and northing) coordinates, according to the current ellipsoid and Polar Stereographic projection coordinates.
      Parameters:
      lon - Longitude to project
      lat - Latitude to project
      Returns:
      Topocentric2DPoint object containing Easting (x coord) and Northing (y coord) in meters
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - error if latitude is in different hemisphere from origin

    • toGeodetic

      @NotNull public @NotNull Geodetic2DPoint toGeodetic(double easting, double northing)
      This method converts Polar Stereographic projection (easting and northing) coordinates to geodetic (latitude and longitude) coordinates, according to the current ellipsoid and Polar Stereographic projection parameters.
      Parameters:
      easting - X in meters
      northing - Y in meters
      Returns:
      Geodetic2DPoint object containing un-projected Longitude and Latitude
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - error if Easting or Northing are out of legal range
